message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $12,000. It's a great deal for you, and I'm confident it will be very valuable to your business. What do you think?

I appreciate your confidence in the product's value, but I'm not sure I can meet your price of $12,000. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for the product, which I think is a fair price considering its value to my business. Can you meet me at this price?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a great deal, and I'm willing to work with you. However, $9,000 just doesn't cover my costs. How about we meet in the middle at $10,000?  I believe this price still represents excellent value for you, and it allows me to make a fair profit. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to work with me, but $10,000 is still a bit too high for my budget. I'm willing to pay $8,500 for the product, which I think is a fair price considering the value it will bring to my business. Can you meet me at this price?

Bob, I understand your budget constraints. While I value your business, $8,500 is unfortunately below my minimum price.  I'm willing to offer you the product for $9,500. This represents a good deal for both of us, and it allows me to make a fair profit while offering you a valuable product.  I believe this is a price we can both agree on.

I understand that you're looking to make a fair profit, but I'm still not comfortable with $9,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $8,500 and $9,500, which would be $9,000. However, I'm willing to compromise a bit further and offer $9,250. Can you meet me at this price?
